_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Pypy
author: mratox@protonmail.com
description: PyPy is an implementation of the Python programming language. PyPy often runs faster than the standard implementation CPython because PyPy uses a just-in-time compiler.
startup: if [[ -d .git ]] && [[ "{{AUTO_UPDATE}}" == "1" ]]; then git pull; fi; if [[ ! -z "{{PYPY_PACKAGES}}" ]]; then pip install -U --prefix .local {{PYPY_PACKAGES}}; fi; if [[ -f /home/container/${REQUIREMENTS_FILE} ]]; then pip install -U --prefix .local -r ${REQUIREMENTS_FILE}; fi; /usr/local/bin/python /home/container/{{MAIN_FILE}}

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Pypy App Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
apt update
apt install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python python-dev libtool

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

if [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "true" ] || [ "${USER_UPLOAD}" == "1" ]; then
    echo -e "assuming user knows what they are doing have a good day."
    exit 0
fi

## add git ending if it's not on the address
if [[ ${GIT_ADDRESS} != *.git ]]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS=${GIT_ADDRESS}.git
fi

if [ -z "${GIT_USERNAME}" ] && [ -z "${GIT_ACCESS_TOKEN}" ]; then
    echo -e "using anon api call"
else
    GIT_ADDRESS="https://${USERNAME}:${GIT_ACCESS_TOKEN}@$(echo -e ${GIT_ADDRESS} | cut -d/ -f3-)"
fi

## pull git pypy repo
if [ "$(ls -A /mnt/server)" ]; then
    echo -e "/mnt/server directory is not empty."
    if [ -d .git ]; then
        echo -e ".git directory exists"
        if [ -f .git/config ]; then
            echo -e "loading info from git config"
            ORIGIN=$(git config --get remote.origin.url)
        else
            echo -e "files found with no git config"
            echo -e "closing out without touching things to not break anything"
            exit 10
        fi
    fi

    if [ "${ORIGIN}" == "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
        echo "pulling latest from github"
        git pull
    fi
else
    echo -e "/mnt/server is empty.\ncloning files into repo"
    if [ -z ${GIT_BRANCH} ]; then
        echo -e "cloning default branch"
        git clone ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    else
        echo -e "cloning ${GIT_BRANCH}'"
        git clone --single-branch --branch ${GIT_BRANCH} ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    fi

fi

export HOME=/mnt/server

echo "Installing pypy requirements into folder"
if [[ ! -z ${PYPY_PACKAGES} ]]; then
    pip install -U --prefix .local ${PYPY_PACKAGES}
fi

if [ -f /mnt/server/requirements.txt ]; then
    pip install -U --prefix .local -r ${REQUIREMENTS_FILE}
fi

echo "-----------------------------------------"
echo "Installation completed..."
echo "-----------------------------------------"

variables.name: Git Repository Address
variables.description: The Git repository address to clone .

variables.name: User Uploaded Files
variables.description:
Skip all the install stuff if you are letting a user upload files.
0 = false (default)
1 = true

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description:
Pull the latest files on startup when using a Git Repository.
0 = false (default)
1 = true

variables.name: Main file
variables.description: The main file passed to the start command.

variables.name: Additional Pypy Packages
variables.description:
Install additional pypy packages.
Use spaces to separate

variables.name: Requirements file
variables.description: if there are other requirements files to choose from.
